#Text=Esbjerg
#Text=Esbjerg is in Jutland , Denmark .
#Text=The city of Esbjerg is Denmark 's fifth largest city and has a population of 72,613 ( 2003 ) .
#Text=It was established around the harbour , which the state had built in 1868 as a replacement for that harbour in Altona that had previously been Denmark 's most important North Sea harbour .
#Text=In 1874 Esbjerg became connected by rail to Fredericia and Varde .
#Text=The town was once Denmark 's biggest fishing harbour , and the harbour is still an economic driving force in the town .
#Text=Get in
#Text=The ferry route from the UK has been discontinued .
#Text=By train
#Text=The train station is in the town centre and this connects you to pretty all of Denmark and beyond .
#Text=From here , DSB operates InterCity trains to Copenhagen via Kolding and Odense and Regional trains to Aarhus via Fredericia .
#Text=Arriva operates trains on the smaller lines south to Ribe , Tønder and Niebüll and north to Varde , Nørre Nebel and Skjern .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Esbjerg Airport is in the eastern part of the city , with local bus connections .
#Text=There are flight connections to London ( Stanstead Airport ) , Aberdeen and Stavanger - Bergen , Norway
#Text=Billund Airport is western Denmark 's biggest and better connected .
#Text=It is conveniently located about an hour 's drive from Esbjerg and there 's a bus connection .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Express buses connect Esbjerg to Aalborg , Aarhus and Sønderborg as well as other towns in Denmark .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The town is centered around the harbour and shopping area ( Skolegade , Kongensgade ) .
#Text=As the town area is rather small , it is possible to get most places by walking .
#Text=However , you might consider using the public bus for the more far sights as Fisheries- and Maritime Museum in Hjerting .
#Text=See
#Text=Man meets the sea .
#Text=Sculpture depicting 4 sitting men looking over the sea .
#Text=Fisheries and Maritime Museum .

#Text=The Fisheries and Maritime Museum is the largest institution of its kind in Denmark focusing on Danish fisheries and marine biology , the tidal wetlands ( Wadden Sea ) , west Jutland coastal shipping and the North Sea offshore industries .
#Text=So the theme of the museum can truly be said to be " people and the sea " .
#Text=Do
#Text=Svømmestadion
#Text=Danmark
#Text=, Gl .
#Text=Vardevej 60 , 6700 Esbjerg .
#Text=Visit the aquatics center Svømmestadion Danmark ( on Strandby Kirkevej/Gl .
#Text=Vardevej crossing )
#Text=Biocity Esbjerg , Gl . Vardevej 66 , 6700 Esbjerg .
#Text=Visit the cinema Biocity Esbjerg ( right next to Svømmestadion Danmark )
#Text=Parks of Esbjerg .
#Text=Stroll around in one of the parks of Esbjerg ; Byparken , Vognsbølparken , I.C. Møllerparken , Vognsbølparken , Hjerting Strandpark .
#Text=In the fenced area Esbjerg Dyrehave in Vognsbølparken , you can interact directly with wildlife animals such as deer and roe
#Text=Island of Fanø .
#Text=From Esbjerg Harbour only 10 minutes on the ferry brings you to the little island Fanø that has great beaches and the villages Nordby and Sønderho
#Text=Buy
#Text=Esbjerg City has some great options for shopping centered around the two main shopping streets .
#Text=Kongensgade is a pedestrianized shopping street and has some 150 specialty shops and eateries .
#Text=Torvegade , partly pedestrianized , is also worth a visit .
#Text=The two converge right around the main square in town .
#Text=Shopping hours are on weekdays from 9-10AM. to 5:30-6:00PM.
#Text=On Saturday , most shops close down at 2PM .
#Text=while Sunday nearly all shops remain closed .
#Text=In the Northern part of Esbjerg the malls Esbjerg Storcenter .
#Text=and City Nord .
#Text=offers even more shopping opportunities .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Esbjerg has some good options for eating out .
#Text=Mammas Pizzeria , Kongensgade 9 , 6700 Esbjerg , ☏ +4588445540 .
#Text=located right on the pedestrian street and serves great inexpensive Italian food
#Text=Den Røde Okse , Tarphagevej 9 , ☏ +4575151500 .
#Text=located a few kilometers from the center does steak and fish well at midrange prices
#Text=Brasserie B , Torvegade 24 ( in Hotel Brittania ) , ☏ +4575130111 .
#Text=Nice open and friendly restaurant from DKK 200 for main courses .
#Text=Sands Restaurant , Skolegade 60 , 6700 Esbjerg , ☏ +4575120207 .
#Text=Sands Restaurant is very good for Danish food
#Text=Drink
#Text=Skolegade is the street where most bars and clubs are located .
#Text=It is in the center of the city .
#Text=Industrien - also serves a really good reasonably priced meal .
#Text=The burgers are recommended .
#Text=Occasionally live music
#Text=Dronning
#Text=Louise
#Text=- Good looking place right on the town square .
#Text=Has got “ English pub ” style live music and a good selection of beer
#Text=Paddy Go Easy -
#Text=Irish Pub

#Text=Close to the water and to the centre of Esbjerg

#Text=Check-in : 2AM , check-out : 11PM .
#Text=Free wireless internet from 1400 ( 700 weekend ) .
#Text=Hotel Scandic Olympic , Strandbygade 3 , 6700 Esbjerg .
#Text=Hjerting Badehotel , Strandpromenaden 1 , 6710 Esbjerg V. Old style beach hotel in Hjerting village approx. 10 km outside Esbjerg city
#Text=ECH Park - Esbjerg Conference Hotel , Stormgade 200 , 6700 Esbjerg .
#Text=Rent a holiday home .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Legoland , Nordmarksvej , 7190 Billund .
#Text=The original Legoland is situated in the town of Billund about an hours drive from Esbjerg where Lego originates and the world heaquarters are located
#Text=Ribe .
#Text=Denmark 's oldest city with a beautiful old town
#Text=Rømø — an island in the North Sea connected to the mainland by a causeway .
#Text=Known for its sand beaches , it 's a favorite among locals and visitors alike .
#Text=Sylt — a German island likewise known for its beaches ; accessible by train from the German mainland or by ferry from Rømø .
#Text=Wadden Sea National Park — the North Sea coast has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site , continuing south into Germany and the Netherlands .
